description: Large double. Good grower, heavy bloomer. Early to mid-season, acid loving plants. Plant in moist well drained soil with pH of 4.0-5.5.
title: Azalea

description: Beautiful large royal purple flowers adorn attractive satiny green leaves that turn orange\/red in cold weather. Grows to up to 18 feet, or prune annually to shorten.
title: Tibouchina Semidecandra

description: Blooms in summer, 20-35 inches high. Fertilize regularly for best results. Full sun, drought tolerant.
title: Hibiscus

description: Quick-growing, herbaceous, shrub reaching up to 30 inches in height, forming a rounded, dense bush.
title: Plectranthus

description: Slow growing, upright to spreading shrub. Oval, glossy, leaves and profuse winter to spring blooming flowers.
title: Camellia Japonica

description: Thorny woody vine scrambles over other plants with their hooked thorns. Pest free.
title: Bougainvillea Spectabilis

description: Deep purple colored flowers bushy rounded growth habit to 3 feet tall. Plant in full sun. Water regularly.
title: Rosa Burgundy

description: Deep purple colored flowers bushy rounded growth habit to 3 feet tall. Plant in full sun. Water regularly.
title: Rosa Iceberg

description: They do not thrive indoors, where the light is too dim, and humidity too low, for them to grow properly.
title: Bonsai Tree

description: Blooms continuously from early spring to first frost. Full sun or part shade, moist well-drained soil.
title: Calibrachoa Noa

description: The flowers last about ten weeks. They have a waxy texture and reach a height of more than 20 inches.
title: Cymbidium Aestivum

description: Creamy-white centers, medium green outer foliage with flattened outer foliage.
title: Brassica Oleracea

description: Compact mounds of colorful dainty flowers, good for window boxes. Fertile well drained soil.
title: Viola Penny

description: Cotula have very fragrant orange flowers that bloom in the middle of summer.
title: Cotula Pincushion

description: Well drained neutral to slightly acid soil, bright light. Do not over-fertilize or these flowers will lose scent.
title: Pelargonium Peltatum

description: Compact mounds of colorful dainty flowers, good for window boxes. Fertile well drained soil.
title: Pansy Blue

description: Compact mounds of colorful dainty flowers, good for window boxes. Fertile well drained soil.
title: Cymbidium Aestivum

description: Choose the brightest windows in your house for your orchids, place on an humidity tray and spray regularly.
title: Phalaenopsis Purple

description: They thrive in fertile, fast draining, slightly alkaline (pH 6.75) soil. Avoid overwatering.
title: Dianthus

description: Chrysanthemums respond to plenty of food and moisture, and prefer full sun.
title: Chrysanthemum

description: Summer flowering, 12–18” high, likes full sun and well drained soil. Drought tolerant.
title: Armeria Alliacea

description: Grows to 15 inches. The species is easy to grow from seeds or cuttings. This species prefers full sun.
title: Salvia Splendens

description: Easily grown, tolerant of drought and poor soil, flower and foliage improves with feeding. Full sun.
title: Agapanthus

description: These plants are very hardy, easy to grow, and increase readily. Average flower size is 3-4 inches in diameter.
title: Iris Sibirica

description: Chrysanthemums grow best and produce the most flowers if they are planted in full sunshine.
title: Chrysanthemum

description: Grown primarily for its attractive silvergray foliage rather than its yellow flowers. Drought tolerant.
title: Senecio Cineraria

description: Add water until there is half inch of dry soil on the surface. Do not water again until the soil is completely dry.
title: Red Cactus

description: Drought tolerant, well drained soil. Prefers full sun.
title: Aloe Vera

description: Easy to care for, requiring watering only when they’re dry. They like bright but indirect light.
title: Exotic Dancer

description: Locate it in a place where it is exposed to at least a few hours of direct sunlight.
title: Schlumbergera

description: These plants blend in among the stones as a means of protection. Grazing animals would otherwise eat them.
title: Lithops

description: The Mexican Fence Post will eventually reach 20 feet tall. Protect the growing tips with Styrofoam cups on the tops.
title: Pachycereus Marginatus

description: Growing as a large roughly spherical globe, it may eventually reach over a meter in height after many years.
title: Golden Barrel

description: The plants should be kept almost completely dry during the winter months, once a month should be fine.
title: Opuntia Falcata
